com.android.test

Annotation Type InjectInstrumentation


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface InjectInstrumentation
    Use this to inject an Instrumentation into your JUnit4-style test.

    To use, just add the correct annotation to an Instrumentation field like this: 

         @InjectInstrumentation public Instrumentation mMyInstrumentation;

    The test runner will set the value of this field with the Instrumentation after object construction but before any Before methods are called.

    Declaring this in a JUnit3 test (ie a class that is a Test) will have no effect. Use InstrumentationTestCase instead for JUnit3 style tests.
